column5: In Ontario and Quebec, Le Baron is probably the biggest dedicated outdoor products store associated with hunting and fishing. However, that doesn't necessarily make them a favourite. They compete very well price wise on what they stock. However, "what they stock" can leave a lot to be desired. Consequently, smaller stores compete on the service side by being prepared to get you what you want even though you'll pay more. Ordering via the internet (e.g. Cabela's, Bass Pro Shops, Stamina's), although the process works very well from my own experience, tends to be prohibitively expensive due to duties and shipping costs. According to the Bass Pro Shop web site, Bass Pro Shops has announced it will open an Outdoor World retail store in the new Vaughan Mills mall near Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The mall is scheduled to open late 2004.

Cabelas,Prarie Du Chien WI Hanks bait and tackle in Waterloo and Iowa Outdoors in Waterloo Iowa. Iowa Outdoors is a small store but good deals I don't think I've ever paid full price for anything there

Cabelas,Prarie Du Chien WI Hanks bait and tackle in Waterloo and Iowa Outdoors in Waterloo Iowa. Iowa Outdoors is a small store but good deals I don't think I've ever paid full price for anything there
Cabelas will never get another dime out of me. Canadian Tire or local tackle/bait stores from now on.
Cabelas will never get another dime out of me. Canadian Tire or local tackle/bait stores from now on.

what are your favorite sporting goods stores in canada?comparible to say,cabelas, gander mountain,scheels,bass pro shops,etc.also who are some of the main distributors for marine products? names and numbers would be great. thank you very much!---robert

in manitoba we don't have anything like that i think your best bet would be lebarons in the toronto ottawa area if you want to deal with individual shops let me know and i could maybe help you out[email protected]
thanks for the reply! any one else? or do you purchase most of your fishing/marine supplies via the internet? thanks---robert
another company with mail order is the fishing hole main office alberta also s.i.r and united army in winnipeg put out catalogs for mailorder search the web and you should find

Gotta mention Thorne Bros in Fridley, MN just off 35E I believe. I've only been there once, but it's an amazing store. They specialize in everything muskie, but have all the basics as well. That place is muskie angler's paradise.

My bad. I didn't see the Canadian aspect of the thread. Canada needs a cabelas or two. I don't think anything can compare to it or a place like Thorne Bros. At least not the places I've visited in Canada.
thanks for the replies guys. keep them coming!---robert
I like Scheels, Flleet Farm , Cbellas, Gander mt. and Bass Pro. Locally it would be Fleet Farm. They have really done a nice job with tackle. i buy rods and reels from Scheels. Great stuff.

Since you asked for a Canadian fishermans perspective. I myself ussually support the local small type "fishing tackle" stores since although they don't have the selection that a Cabela's does they have the selection focused to what works in local waters, and besides they help pay my City taxes. When that fails to have what I need, I go to the local Canadian Tire Store, that ussually has all that I need and at reasonable prices. jake
